page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
{HEATLEY COTTAGE}- Listed Archect./Hist Grade II (606949) Mainly Tudor but restored in 1955/56 to expose timber framed exterior with in-filling plaster, brick nogging on ground storey, origional window openings with 2/3 latticed lead casement lights, three chimney stacks (2 diagonal + 1 cruciform), tiled roof all surrounded by walled garden.
{Glantham's Lodge}- Listed Grade II (607949) Owned by local Optician. Built in 1750 by Richard Heatley, Tea Broker. Walls display a "History of Bricks" dating from Shenfield Brick Company ownership. Small stream surfacing in garden is only remaining feature in area linking{Mill Hill}and {Mill pond.}
